title: SDMO logo condensed sans
content:
Hey can anyone tell me what this font is? I know I've seen it but can't place/remember what it is. I t may have been altered slightly... ie the 's' has been changed.

Cheers  
Giles

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022054823im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sdmo_4863.jpg)
author: Giles

comments.content: Looks like Futura Bold Condensed to me.

Nope, [it's not](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022054823/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/bitstream/futura_bold_condensed_ot/&sample_text=SDMO&sample_size=60). Nor is it [Agenda Bold Extra Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022054823/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/font_bureau/agenda_bold_extra_condensed/&sample_text=SDMO&sample_size=60). :^/
This is very bizarre -- the order of the comments have switched without Sebastian editing anything!?

I'm pretty sure that the DMO part is Agenda but the S is throwing me off. [Here's a link](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022054823/http:/www.lennandia.com/typophile/SDMO.pdf) to a PDF of the logo (taken from SDMOs homepage) for a closer look...

Where did you take the pdf logo? Did you just extract it from the pdf documentation files at the link [SDMO Commercial Leaflets](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022054823/http:/www.sdmo.com/sitev3/index.asp?lng=GB&ID=5&IDC=1) ?

If I look at the different weights of Agenda, the one that seems to fit the best is Agenda Bold Extra condensed. However, if I compare the M in the logo (left) and the M in Agenda (right) they dont' look the same

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022054823im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mcompared_4580.gif)

<cite>Where did you take the pdf logo? Did you just extract it from the pdf documentation files at the link SDMO Commercial Leaflets ?</cite>

Yes...

<cite>If I look at the different weights of Agenda, the one that seems to fit the best is Agenda Bold Extra condensed. However, if I compare the M in the logo (left) and the M in Agenda (right) they dont’ look the same</cite>

You're right, Michel! May this be a custom work?

\> May this be a custom work?

I guess that for logos, this is a likely occurrence. It is interesting to notice that in the SDMO leaflets, when they need a "compound" logo, either they use another font for "SDMO" or mix the original logo with some other font. Here is an example

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022054823im_/http:/typophile.com/files/MicsTELYS_5255.jpg)
  
where, according Acrobat, the font used for "Mics TELYS" is "Ostara" (?). This being said, I am no designer.

Ostara is – according to Uli Stiehls fontforgery website – a softmaker-/brendel-clone of [Anzeigen Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022054823/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/anzeigen-grotesk/familytree.html)
